channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A recession could test whether AI is truly fueling an economy with ‘jobless growth’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Russians Awake to Trump’s New Oil Sanctions and Largely Shrug
item.description: While oil markets reacted strongly to the sanctions, analysts said the measures were unlikely to significantly change President Vladimir V. Putin’s wa...

item.title: U.S. national debt hits $38 trillion and Washington is ‘numb to our own dysfunction,’ budget committee warns
item.description: America's debt mountain is eye-watering. The interest alone costs $1.21 trillion annually— 17% of total federal spending.

item.title: Cybersecurity experts warn OpenAI’s ChatGPT Atlas is vulnerable to attacks that could turn it against a user—revealing sensitive data, downloading malware, or worse
item.description: Experts caution that AI-powered browsers like ChatGPT Atlas could open the door to new kinds of attacks—from prompt injections to data leaks—as artifi...

item.title: AI’s insatiable need for power is driving an unexpected boom in oil-fracking company stocks
item.description: The CEO of the U.S. energy secretary's fracking company said Trump's tariffs are getting in the way of U.S. energy and AI dominance.

item.title: King Charles and Pope Leo Pray Together in Groundbreaking Moment
item.description: The moment marked the first time that the leaders of the Catholic and Anglican churches had done so in years, offering a display of unity between the ...

item.title: U.S. May Seek United Nations Mandate for Gaza Security Force, Rubio Says
item.description: Before boarding a plane for Israel, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that U.N. backing was a potential next step to deploying an international stab...

item.title: Corning CEO says Steve Jobs pressured him into making all the screens for the first iPhone: ‘Do you know what your biggest problem is? You’re afraid’
item.description: According to Wendell Weeks, Jobs said if Corning couldn't help Apple deliver on "the biggest product in history ... I'm going to eviscerate you."

item.title: U.S. Expands Boat Strikes to Pacific, and Trump Tears Down East Wing
item.description: Plus, the island that just got its first mosquitoes.

item.title: Harvard Records an Increase in Asian Students and a Drop in Black Students
item.description: The shift mirrors trends at other elite schools after a ban on affirmative action. The Trump administration has said it wants to scrutinize demographi...

item.title: Britain’s Labour Party Criticizes Farage Over Ties to U.S. Anti-Abortion Group
item.description: The governing party said it was “deeply concerning” that Nigel Farage’s appearance in the U.S. Congress had been brokered by an organization that help...

item.title: Oil Price Jumps on Trump’s Russia Sanctions
item.description: Traders are pondering whether the United States and its allies are finally getting serious about restricting Russian energy.
